intro: Polyscias pentamera, commonly known as the Five-leaf Polyscias, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that often have five lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Polyscias pentamera is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
